page.title: 16FULNECK MORAVIAN SETTLEMENT
page.content: On the southern outskirts of Pudsey on one of the most beautiful sites for many miles there is a little village about half a mile long called Fulneck.It was founded in the middle of the 18th century by preachers from Moravia (now part of Czechoslovakia). The name of Fulneck is known throughout the world because of the Moravians' missionary work.In this country it is well-known because of the two private schools in the village.Between them they have 800 pupils,some of whom are boarders. Other places of interest in the village are a museum,a pottery,a shop, a tea-room and,of course,the main building is the church.Activities in the village include a dramatic society, Boys' Brigade,youth club and Ladies' Circle.
